snippet: A fire that ripped through the home of an Orthodox Jewish family, trapping the children — ages 5 to 16 — in their bedrooms, was sparked by a malfunctioning hot plate, officials said.
abstract: Fire in Brooklyn home of Orthodox Jewish family kills seven children, with only the mother Gayle Sassoon and her daughter Siporah able to escape flames, by leaping from second-floor windows; investigators say unknown malfunction in electrical hot plate used by family to keep food warm for Sabbath is responsible.

byline.original: By BENJAMIN MUELLER and NATE SCHWEBER
byline.contributor: Al Baker, Jason Grant, Winnie Hu, Kate Pastor and Ashley Southall contributed reporting. Susan C. Beachy contributed research.

lead_paragraph: A fire that ripped through the home of an Orthodox Jewish family, trapping the children — ages 5 to 16 — in their bedrooms, was sparked by a malfunctioning hot plate, officials said.

headline.main: Brooklyn Fire Kills 7 Children, City’s Worst Toll Since 2007
headline.print_headline: Brooklyn Fire Kills 7 Children, Worst Toll in City Since 2007
